  3678. My husband was a little reluctant at first but sat in the chair.
  3679. Its a heavy duty well made set, with all the attachments you could need.<br />Shipping was very fast as well.
  3680. it cut right through my hair not much vibration and it half as loud as this thing was.
  3681. I was a bit worried about the reviews saying the combs were weak and fell off easy.

  3690. After a year of heavy use the machine still works pretty well.
  3691. It broke on the first use, but the clippers and attachments more than made up for that minor disappointment.
  3692. This weighty trimmer feels far more expensive than it actually is.
  3693. I have very thick hair and this one mows thru it easy .

  3695. Cheaper hair cutters also become dull rather quickly which causes them to pull hair.
  3696. the only thing i would point out is do not loose the oil and the brush.
  3697. I suggest lubricating every other or after a day of heavy use by lightly oiling and then allowing blades to move back and forth after cleaning.
  3698. I've always had to be careful when breaking in a new set of clippers to not cut my ears,
  3699. Not much to say about this new Wahl cutter.
  3700. But if you keep them dry or dry them off right after you use them they will last a long time!
  3701. Other than that, I highly recommend this trimmer.
  3702. yeah, there's a mess to clean up afterward, but these things don't get bogged down, cut consistently, and don't pull people's hari out.
  3703. Now I'm slightly less deaf and much happier as result.
  3704. It does the job in half the time, gets very close, plugs in, and I don't have to worry about charging.
  3705. the whole kit costs less than a haircut.

All Reviews

  1. Amazing trimmer! I have used this item to trim the hair of all of the men in my life. It works excellently. Lots of options for different levels of cuts. It also came with oil for the trimmer, scissors, and a few combs!
  2. I really liked the &#34;chrome&#34; plastic finish on the handle of these clippers. However, since I cut my own hair, I have a problem with the chrome finish reflecting too much light. It poses a distraction when trying to achieve an even fade with a more natural blend. The light that reflects off the clippers (which can be seen in my mirror's reflection) can kind of make lines appear on my hair that aren't really there. This mostly happens when cutting the hair on the back of my head.<br /><br />The blades cut really well. Definite upgrade over my old Wahl clippers which I had used for about the past 10 years. If you cut your own hair, I would advise against the chrome body and go for a solid colored plastic model. Overall a great product for the price
  3. This is a great clipper - so far anyway - just started using it - the attachments are wonderful - love the eyebrow attachment!!! Great sale too!
  4. Great clippers for the money
  5. I cut my bf's hair for the first time with this!!!!!!!! Worked well!
  6. It's a good value cutters for the price but , it's heavy, big, slippery, and NOISY !
  7. High quality for the price and made in USA. It cuts very evenly and without any effort at all. It's quiet too. Highly recommend.
  8. Works like a charm! Save so much money doing haircuts at home!

  12. I have bought these as I regularly pay $40-50 for my hair cut at my preferred saloon. I have used them with the assistance of my girlfriend on three occasions to trim my back and sides of my hair, whilst keeping a long center region to be able to style.<br /><br />In terms of an electric razor, they are perfectly sharp (for the limited times I have used them) and there are enough adjustments to cover the range of hair length for my needs along the side. (I do not use this razor for the center, where I use scissors and shears instead). It is also a good idea to finish off a &#34;buzzcut&#34; with a pair of shears to blend the transitions of hair length.<br /><br />Overall, I am very happy with the purchase and see them as a great value for money. I highly advise getting a pair of shearing scissors to give your hair cut a more &#34;natural&#34; finish!

  28. I bought a Wahl, because the name has been around forever and it has a good reputation. That said, I bought this particular product, because I had gotten my hair cut short (crew cut), after a barber gave me a VERY bad hair cut. Actually the barber did me a great favor, because I realized that the tool she was using to cut my hair was most likely a Wahl, or Wahl like tool. Between banging it against my head and coming close to cutting off my ear (an exaggeration, but it felt that way) and then giving me really bad results, I decided to buy my own electric clipper set.<br />I know the Wahl name and when I saw this set and the very reasonable price, I just ordered it. I've used it twice now and that has paid for the tool and all the accessories I got with it. I never knew what they meant by &#34;What number do you want on the sides?&#34; I always looked at them with a blank look. The Wahl Pro has many clipper heads, all numbered and I discovered that the best for me is # 2 on the sides and # 3 on top and I don't have to be beaten in the process.<br />We are going to cut our grandson's hair, which is longer, but feel very confident with the ease of use of this product. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to save money going to the barber, or just wants to look good when your hair starts getting a bit shaggy, in between visits. It has a SOLID build and lot's of useful accessories.<br />Great Product, Great Deal, I'm Very Happy!!!

For something so affordable I wouldn't complain at all. You get guide combs, combs to comb your hair, scissors, hair pins, oil, and a cape. The scissors are cool; kinda cheap but it's alright. As for the cape, it is nice to have one so that you won't get hair all over you. I tried tying one of the strings together and one of them tore, but no biggie as I still managed to get the cape on good. It doesn't come with a trimmer but for a several more dollars you could buy a Wahl set that has one. I have an Oster T-Trimmer that works very well so I didn't need an extra one. Overall I am satisfied with the product. Would definitely buy a Wahl product again.

  108. Avoid this product unless you don't plan on using the guards! The guards are made of cheap plastic that will constantly \\"spread\\" when you are cutting your hair. I use the #2 guard to cut my hair and I constantly have a bad haircut when I use these clippers. The plastic is thin, cheap, and flexible on the #2 guard such that if you cut your hair with any downward pressure whatsoever, the guard flexs and creates uneven clipping. This spreading and flexing of the guard leads to wavy and uneven cuts of your hair. I would absolutely not recommend this product to anyone who cuts their hair using a guard. The clippers have good power and would be fine for anyone not using a guard. But the cheap guard really ruins the product.
  109. The product works great. It's in perfect condition and came with all the pieces! I use it all the time!
  110. I HATE HATE HATE paying to get my hair cut. You either shell out tons of cash or you go to a place that charges ~$20 bucks for the same basic, generic haircut that is all done with clippers and might as well be buzzed anyway. For less than the price of 2 haircuts at a strip mall I got this. In retrospect I wish I spent the $8 more for the one with the personal/around ear trimmer. I figured this has ear guards, and I have a microtouch so let's save a couple of bucks. Still not regretting the purchase. Smooth, powerful cutting. I shaved my own head and this made it easy to do, even in the back. The blades don't loose power at certain angles like the cheapies can.
  111. Great equipment quick delivery
  112. The clippers work fantastic and cut my hair great. I've had no pulls or any other issues with them. I don't think these clippers are louder than any other clippers that I have had used and even though I've only had them for a short time the durability seems to be good so far. The set includes a ton of pieces even though I only use the guard and the case is pretty nice. Overall this is a great price that will save you a ton of money when considering how much even cheap places like great clips charges. I'm sure that you can get more powerful and more durable professional models but they will also probably cost a lot more. If you are looking for just a simple great pear of clippers for normal use you cant get much better than these.
  113. One star maybe too generous. I bought this model of clippers at a big box store. When I went to cut my son's hair a couple days later the clippers would not work properly. They pulled my son't hair instead of cut it. I turned it off and back on and noted that it didn't look like the blade was moving side to side like it should. I &#34;banged&#34; it on my hand a few times and it started working. Then it would stop. I'd hit it against my hand and it would start working again. Poor guy - my son hates having his hair cut and thought if I could do it quickly with clippers it would be nice for both of us. It took us a long time to get his hair cut. He was a good sport about it but I was very disappointed in this product as I understand Wahl is a reputable name.

The black sizing combs that you attach to the razor look like they came out of a McDonald's happy meal. As do the actual combs. The plastic is thin, brittle and so weak it appears like it could snap at any moment. Also, the \\"cape\\" is simply a glorified kitchen garbage bag. Literally the same thickness. I would not recommend this kit to anyone, and would instead recommend spending another $25 and getting a higher quality model... that's what we are going to do.

  135. Ok, I was a little nervous at first, since I've never cut my own hair. But, I've always said I've watched them cut my hair enough times I know I could do it if I could take my head off. Since that is not the best idea in the world. The Wahl cutter is the next best thing. READ the instructions. Most males do not. I am male. Therefore I did not. Almost disaster, but not quite. Remember to come from the back of the head and move forward. My hair is split down the middle and if cut too short will tend to spike. At first after I did the back I moved to the front and went at it with a forward motion, wrong! It cut too close. Thought I was going to end up with a reverse mohawk. Not in my plans. So, read the manual a little more. Went from the back forward throughout the whole cut and after putting some styling mousse through my hair I was amazed at how well my first cut turned out. I knew that in about 2 or 3 weeks if cut evenly will grow back uniformly which it is doing nicely. Would highly recommend this product. I think before I ordered this that some people complained of it being noisy. It's not any more noisy than the ones they use in the hair salons. One more cut and it will have paid for itself. PS: My wife's name is on the review instead of mine. Don't know why as I clicked on the email link asking me to write a review. I purchased it, she didn't. Stupid Flanders. D'oh MMcGrath

  142. These clippers are very solid, clip smoothly and don't get too hot. Wahl's web site doesn't provide much on specifications, but I found the Wahl global site that confirms the standard blade on this clipper cuts from 0.8mm to 2.5mm, though the blade number is different in this country: [[ASIN:B000FJ17N0 WAHL Professional 2 Hole Precision Clipper Blade (Model:1045-100)]]. There's also a finer blade available that cuts from 0.4mm to 1.0mm, [[ASIN:B000I3MRHI Wahl 1026-515 close cut clipper blade]] if you want to go even shorter. I learned this from Wahl's global site at: [...] Unfortunately this information is sadly lacking from Wahl's US site.<br /><br />Anyway, this kit comes with far more accessories than I will ever need, as I mostly use the 1/16\\", 1/8\\" guides or the bare blade. This clipper vibrates much less than an older Andis kit I owned previously. Many reviewers complain about the poor quality of the guides, but they're the same as those my ex-barber uses. As they're meant to glide through hair, they don't need to be very stiff.<br /><br />After two cuts, I've pretty much got my favorite cut figured out, and the kit has already paid for itself. I like that the clipper comes with a five-year warranty, and I've found Wahl's customer service to be very helpful in providing information when I've emailed and called.<br /><br />I'm very satisfied with this kit!<br /><br />Update May 10, 2014: I've been using these clippers once weekly since I purchased the kit, and they're still going strong. I've saved A LOT of cash since I quit going to the barber. :-)
  143. After my roommate banned me from using his Remmington, I had to get my own and so I did. This Whal does what you want and I find it so convenient that I cut my hair every month. I have to remind myself not to keep it on all the time.<br /><br />Best thing about this Whal is that I find myself wanting to cut my hair more often.

  148. After reading several reviews I chose these clippers. My husband has been bugging me forever to cut his hair, and he likes it short. Not being a hair stylist I begged off the job for several years. Finally, after losing a bet on a basketball game, where he agreed to shave his head, I decided I wasn't letting one of his friends wield anything going near his head. I didn't have any \\"human\\" clippers so I used a pair of old clippers that we used to use on my families show cattle. I did a decent job considering the size of these clippers. However, I wasn't going to use them ever again! This is were Wahl comes into play. They are very easy to use, and all the different guides are extremely helpful. The guides allowed me to \\"play\\" with the length of his hair without getting to close. The cut was super clean, so I would try a longer length guide to start and then go smaller from there depending on how short you want to go. Compared to the only other clippers I've used these are quite and easy to handle. I'm still getting the hang of it, but I'm guessing it will only take a couple of more times and I'll be a pro! :-)

  150. I purchased this set to give myself haircuts as well as shave our cats for the summer. It turns out that the clipper is satisfactory for both tasks. I found I have to go over the cats more than once in certain areas, but it's not much of a hassle. As for the rest of the kit, it is not hard to tell that the accessories are cheaply made. The combs and guides are flimsy - and as other reviewers have stated, the barber poncho is essentially a garbage bag. However, the guides are pretty adequate, and as long as you aren't rough with them I doubt you'll break anything. Switching guides on the clipper is a breeze as they snap on and off easily - but not too easily. Overall, Wahl's product isn't jaw-droppingly amazing, but it's good deal for 27 dollars. My wife gave me an excellent haircut in 15 minutes. The clipper itself is also surprisingly heavy and solid, which suggests reliability to me. It is also easy to take apart for oiling/cleaning. We've only used the item a few times so I can't speak to its longevity, but if it lasts a year I'll have gotten my money's worth for sure.

I learned that mistake early on when i first began cutting my hair.<br /><br />My two gripes about the product are the clipper attachment feel cheap like i'm going to break them when i snap them on to the sheers.   206. What can I say it's Wahl and it's American made. The second I got it I used it and let me tell you this is the best clippers I have even bought. It's the same quality clippers barbers use in a barber shop. The clippers just hum not that annoying loud sounds cheap clippers make. And the switch is just like the barbers use. It makes that noticeable click sounds the pros use. Means its a high quality clipper. I first had the Conair HCT495 in black for about three years then finally I dropped the clipper and the blade broke. And then replaced it with the Conair HCT495 in Chrome. And had that for about 2 years and the bottom blade wasn't touching the top blade anymore when set at the closes setting. I replaced them with this Wahl set and I'll never go back to Conair ever again. And the weight of the Wahl vs the Conair is noticeable. The Wahl has more weight to it which is a great thing. Means it's made to last.
  207. I rarely feel like I got more than I paid for. These clippers seem well built and work well especially when you consider the price. I chose this product over the others specifically for the location of its manufacture. Are you listening corporate America?

The clip's aren't that great quality but you get what you pay for. It does the job. I feel like it cuts a little bit unevenly. Like you can go over the same area and some hair will be SLIGHTLY shorter or longer than the same hair. Could be just my head, or my imagination.   222. This is the third haircutting kit that I have owned in the last ten years or so (one simply stopped working, the other got ruined when my wife tried to use it to cut the dog's hair). This kit from Wahl is the best one we have owned. I use it to cut our childrens' hair. Very sturdy, makes easy cuts without pulling or getting caught. I highly recommend it.
  223. After cutting my family's hair for ten years with two different sets of Conair clippers, I finally bought this American-assembled Wahl set. WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG? These clippers are fabulous! Sharp and clean cutting, I cut my boys' hair in half the time, with better results. I didn't notice the noise either. Box says there is a *five year warranty* and *30-day money-back guarantee*. Now it must be admitted that the \\"24-piece\\" description is nearly irrelevant, as pieces include clips, combs, a garbage-bag type cape, and some cheap scissors, but the scissors will do until you get better ones (highly recommended--visit a beauty supply store and try out some), and one of the combs is not too bad. The box is a great design and holds everything with room for extras. The latch on it may not last so long, but we'll see. The guards are budget-produced as well, but they do the job on these wonderful clippers. I seriously could not stop saying \\"I love these clippers!\\" as I cut their hair =). The only thing you need besides good scissors is a nice brush for the neck. If you're looking for a well-priced tool that does the job, this is it.

  238. These clippers include everything you need. I haven't had any of the plastic pieces break on me and the clipper has stood the test of time under heavy use.<br /><br />Be sure to oil them regularly. One issue I've found is that if hair gets caught, or if they are not oiled properly, it will make a very loud and unsettling vibrating rumble. This is accentuated when holding the clippers upside down. Just oil it after every dozen or so uses and be sure to clear out the teeth with a brush after each use.

  243. I love it and it works great!
  244. I previously had a cheap con-air clipper set that starting making an awful loud clicking noise that no amount of tinkering and grease could fix. I replaced the Con Air with this Wahl model. Now I'm slightly less deaf and much happier as result. The Wahl is not near as loud as the Con Air, but it's not the most quiet set of clippers either. It's a bit louder than most Barber-shop, professional clippers. The important part is that these clippers work. They cut hair very well. I use it for beard trimming and shaving my head. I usually use the green 1/2, 1, 2, or 3 guards. The no-guard setting is short, but not skin-tight. I agree with some of the other reviews stating it does not get as close and skin-tight as some people prefer, but I have a dedicated Norelco for that close of a shave. Bottom line is it's perfect for beard trims and haircuts, but I wouldn't use it as a daily close-shave razor.
  245. Bought this to replace an old set of clippers that started pulling hair. These are good for the money, and very smooth cutting.

Seriously, your wasting your review if that is all you have to complain about with these clippers. If your wanting a nice cut for a low price these are the clippers to have. Besides they are made in USA unlike the competition of Con Air.
  247. I bought this to gift it to my friend in India. But was surprised to know that the product does not meet international standards. The voltage input is restricted to 110v and hence it will not work in countries that have 230v~50hz AC mains. I returned it instantly for a refund. If your usage for this product is international, I DO NOT recommend this product.

Actually, it turned out much better than it had using scissors, and it was so much faster, too! I like all of the attachments that it came with even though I probably won't use most of them. Still, it's nice to know that I have all these extras just in case...you never know. Anyways, I fully recommend this hair clipper. It's a whole lot better doing it this way than cutting too short and there's no going back from there!

Pros: -blades stay very sharp -no snagging of the hair -lots of combs, although i only use 3 or 4 -plenty of accessories -great price Cons: -when the clippers are on, the micro adjustment vibrates and changes, so you have to keep manually putting it back (really the only big gripe for me) -longest comb is for 1 inch, so that can be a limitation for some -on/off switch can be a little difficult to operate when using the clippers (however this may be a pro since you will be less likely to bump it on accident)

  334. I am a single mother that has to save money when I can, and cutting my 20 month old son's hair myself is one of the things I have to do in order to make ends meet.<br /><br />I purchased this along with an extra bottle of blade lube, and have had zero problems. The cord stretches with plenty of room, and I usually let my son play with it (supervised, of course) so he isn't afraid of the noise or vibration. The cape that comes with it feels pretty flimsy, so I like to just drape a towel around his shoulders. I think this helps him feel more secure as well, as it isn't a completely strange feeling.<br /><br />I do recommend starting with the longer guards (the things that go over the blade). When I first started cutting his hair, I realized almost immediately that it was too short. It cuts great though, and it didn't take long to get his whole head done.<br /><br />I would definitely buy again, as this has many attachments to use for all kinds of different hair styles and lengths. The quality seems great, and it doesn't feel or look cheap by any means. Included is an instruction manual that I really should have paid more attention to, but I was pretty eager to see results immediately, so at least now I'll know for next time. It also comes with a nice carrying case, that I was also able to fit the extra bottle of blade lube that I purchased from another seller.<br /><br />As a mom that is new to cutting hair, I found this extremely easy to use, and if needed, I will definitely purchase again!<br /><br />Hannah Booth

  410. I recently wasted money by buying this kit at a big store, instead of amazon. But that's my fault! I have been to 2 or 3 large beauty supply stores and probably 29 different locations between Houston and LA. My requirements err simple. I wanted the least expensive, make brand clippers available that were adjustable, but could cut to bald (.000&#34;) or (.0000&#34;), as per multiple models advertised at aSilly's beat supply. Unfortunately, i had to stand there in Sillys for an hour looking at amazon reviews comparing.in store models. All adjustable models in their stock, that advertised.cutting to bald were $100...the clerk seemed really surprised that i didn't want to cough up that much money for a it.:-O explained to her that i have owned at least 10 clippers that have performed flawlessly. And usually for $10. Well, finally broke down any bought this set . It performed flawlessly, with great power. For questions of how close these cut, you have to understand that decent quality clippers have 2 screws affixing the to blade. If you loosen these guys, you can push the top blade back and tighten with less clearance for a zero cut. Be careful not to go to far, or you risk scalping yourself.You may also adjust the adjustment lever for more tension. Final A adjustments can be made for the throw of the cutting blades by turning large plastic side scree to decrease noise. Note: the Conned heir brand build many of thier models to not have blades adjusted, rendering them useless for short cuts. The motor designs are weaker, and the are beaucoup weak plastic pieces in the drive train lending themselves too much movement, inprecision and rapid blade wear. These budget minded wahlshave no similar bs issues. After I get my money's worth many times over for thesei will likely invest in Wahl brand top end clippers for lifetime use.

A cordless clipper gives one more flexibility and mobility, but a corded unit like the Wahl 79524-2501 has an adequately lengthed cord, more power than a cordless, and no waiting time for a charge.<br /><br />I'd definitely recommend this Wahl hair cutting kit.

I don't know how well they would work for anything fancier, but for a buzz cut, I couldn't ask for anything better for the price. One thing that I've noticed is that the power cord needs to be in the electrical outlet perfectly or the clippers will turn off. Since the cord is moving around a bit as you're moving around the clippers, it tended to wiggle out a bit and turn itself off quite regularly. The selection of guards that comes with this is nice. I personally only used the #3 guard and was happy with its length. As noted by everyone else, the cape that comes with these is horrible and basically just a white trash bag-- I didn't even use it.   456. The first time I used this clipper, I put on the 1/16th adjuster and had no issues. It's not a loud clipper like some people have claimed.<br /><br />However, the second time I used it, I didn't use any attachments, just did a straight cut with the blades like I used to do with my old clipper, and that was when I realized there is something very wrong with this product. It nicked up my scalp, left visible red marks, and left me in pain, particularly around my hairline at the top of my neck. I won't use it again.<br /><br />I did use clipper oil. I have been shaving my head without any length adjustments for a number of years and never had any pain or red marks.<br /><br />I do not work for a rival company - I'm just a bald guy living out my life in relative obscurity. ; - )
  457. This is my 4th pair of Wahl Trimmers over the last 10 years. These are great, no pulling, good clean cut.
  458. I bought these clippers a few years back and used them probably 2-3 times a month. They worked great, never had any problems with them until last week when they just completely stopped working. They don't turn on at all anymore. I've had other Wahl clippers that started chattering, or just got too loud that I replaced because they were probably going bad. But this is the first one that completely stopped working w/o warning (no loudness/chattering beforehand). Still, I would buy another set (and am about to) w/o hesitation.

  461. Great value, excellent clippers. Dead silent and work like a charm, although corded so limits their range, not a big deal to me. I suggest lubricating every other or after a day of heavy use by lightly oiling and then allowing blades to move back and forth after cleaning.
  462. The first 9 months of cutting my hair and my brothers hair, it was great. I felt no pulling or straining. It cut hair very smoothly. Easy to use. It actually isn't that loud at all. It sounds quieter than most barber shop clippers and it isn't scary to use. The chrome is just for show. Today, I bought the Wahl Color Pro because this clipper is now useless, and it is the same exact product, except cheaper and has a plastic finish and more colors instead! I would highly recommend that one instead.<br />The clippers started to fail after 9 months. I kept it clean and oiled, but it just kept getting louder and louder along with the vibrations. I got mad and threw them on the floor 4 times that I broke it, but I still finished my hair cut.<br /><br />Cons:<br />`It gets hot after 30 minutes of usage, but I think that's normal.<br />`If you don't keep the hair off the blades and oil it frequently, it will get loud and vibrate like a dildo.<br /><br />I wouldn't recommend this one for $30. I recommend this product instead, which is the exact clipper, but in a plastic shell: [[ASIN:B000JNQSIQ Wahl 79300 400 Color Complete Haircutting]]<br /><br />For the price you pay, you save a lot than going to the hair cutter! I had no experience in cutting my own hair, but I soon learned. The first 4 cuts were horrible, but now I know how to cut my hair as good as my previous barber. :)

  549. My husband wrote the review: I bought this since I was already cutting my hair at home with a smaller cutter that was already beginning to fade. I knew the Wahl name from my old barber and from a pair of clippers my mother had as I grew up, so the name already spoke of quality in my head. I have used these about a dozen times and I simply buzz my hair to one length probably once every week or 10 days. They work flawless with a plastic guard on them (I use the 1/2 size) and are a little &#34;grippy&#34; without a guard on but don't rip out hairs. I did drop them and chip an end tooth and 1/2 the one next to it off, but they continue to work without incident, the nice part is the part that broke is replaceable so these will be around for a while.<br /><br />The only complaint is they vibrate pretty heavily when compared to my old cordless trimmer, HOWEVER, these are by far beefier and better made. The motors between the 2 cannot be compared because that is apples to oranges. They aren't a barbershop professional grade trimmer since that is NOT what they are. If a slightly noisy and vibrating trimmer isn't what you want, by a pro-grade Wahl and not these. But if you want something to do your own hair with, your kids, you neighbors, whatever, then these are a perfect at home set. It comes with a lot of clipper trim lengths and the cord if plenty long.<br /><br />I would highly recommend these to any friend that isn't a barber/hair stylist.

My guess is anyone who has had problems with this jamming up didn't make that adjustment when they needed too.

  594.   635. Nearly a year ago I began cutting my own hair at home after dealing with paying $20+ per month and being unhappy with haircuts that were at best inconsistent and at worst just bad. To be clear, I like a very simple haircut that can almost completely be done with a clipper, but it does involve gradual changes in length. Now that I've gotten the hang of cutting my own hair, I'm much happier - being able to cut my hair every two weeks so that it always looks neat and trimmed, just the way I like it - without constantly flushing money away.<br /><br />The quality of this clipper set is top notch. I don't know anything about professional clippers, but I can't imagine how they would be much better than this. The build quality is very good and it fields substantial in hand. They never get bogged down by my thick hair, and its easy enough for my to use on my own head. The cord is of good quality and a useful length, and the kit comes with a good assortment of attachments and tools, all in a compact case. And you get all this for just a smidge more than what I was paying for an fairly low price haircut! I'm sure I'll be using this for many years to come.
  636. I have been using this hair cutter for the few months. I use it as an all-around body trimmer as opposed to just my head. I must say it does its job very well. It has proven to be very durable and after many uses it still cuts like day one. The razor is relatively quiet and does not vibrate as much as other I have used in the past. It does not pull any hair and has not caused any skin irritation whatsoever.<br /><br />As far as price is concerned I think it is reasonable. The build quality is solid and like I mentioned before it has proven to be very durable even after extended usage. I have experience with cheaper hair cutters and they are not fun. They would start breaking down after a few uses and make more noise than a lawnmower. Cheaper hair cutters also become dull rather quickly which causes them to pull hair. It hurts and makes the experience very uncomfortable.<br /><br />The kit comes with the standard set of hair combs. It comes with 11 in total ranging from 3 mm to 25 mm. It also comes with one for the left and right ears and one for the eyebrows. Inside you will also find a small comb a scissor. All of it comes in its own storage case which is durable and portable.<br /><br />Overall, I am pretty satisfied and would recommend this razor to anyone who is looking to purchasing a good durable hair trimmer at an affordable price.

Also don't use ear guide because they're shaky when attached on the cutter and can screw up really bad when cutting on the side/back of the ear (I have a dent in the hair on the back of my ear because I trusted the guide).<br /><br />Other than that, the product is worth its price and feels really good to use.

At this point, I can't say how they will hold up over time, but I am very satisfied with them now. I was worried that the eyebrow trimming tool would cut too short, but it really does a great job. The included scissors could have been better/sharper, but otherwise it's a great set.
  702. Can NOT be used (horrible noise and vibration) in countries with a power supply of 220 V & 50 Hz, even though a transformer is used to convert the voltage from 220 to 110/120 V!! The clipper can only work at 110/120 V, 60 Hz. Its working frequency is fixed, not 50/60 Hz!! It would be helpful if this important information can be given in product description. Amazon customer service is good though.
  703. Loved this piece.<br />It's so easy to cut your hair with this. And it's cheap.<br />And there are like 8-9 sizes that comes with this kit.<br />Very impressed with this kit. Saves a lot of money compare to barber shop.
  704. I got this couple of months ago and it is still working perfectly fine. Works great, comes with a lot of extra stuff (scissors, extensions etc.). Definitely recommended. Good stuff.

This trimmer never snags, cuts cleanly, and is fast. It's a little loud, but nothing unbearable. It comes with all the accessories you would need except for a brush to clean the blades. It even comes with a picture-guide on how to cut hair.<br /><br />I tried cutting my own hair with a fade, and it really didn't come out all that nice. In fact, it looked pretty funny.   708. This product cuts decent enough but upon opening the box and turning it on i found out this product was extremely loud to a point where my family downstairs could hear the noise. After searching online i found out you can adjust the dial to reduce the noise which didnt work.. so i found a solution where i had to open the sheer and that metal piece that vibrates is hitting the other metal part causing this loud noise. So the simple fix i had to place a piece of sponge between the metals and guess what it solved all my problems and the loud noise. im giving a 3 star because i had to tune the device due to it being loud when i sud just have had to plug and play with no complications.
  709. Awesome, does exactly as described
  710. My wife now cuts my hair, saving me $20 every time. Easy. Product works great. I called the company for an<br />extra comb (size 1.5) and they sent it right out.

  713. my wife cuts my hair every two weeks since 2011 with these . she didn't tell me the oil ran out and doesnt remember how long ago she ran out , and it locked up . just ordered another with 2 extra bottles of oil =) who knows maybe the other set may work when oiled , it still hummed the blades just didn't move . I have very thick hair and this one mows thru it easy . if you do an extra pass or two when your done it will get any stray hairs it missed . it takes my wife maybe 6 minutes , with 2 minutes spent on eyebrows lol . this is well worth it imo . 16$ at the barber every two weeks adds up fast .<br />UPDATE 7/25<br />I figured out that my outlet blew the GFI breaker and the original clippers still work , I feel like an idiot . the good news is I kept the new ones so I don't have to worry down the road when it does die .

  715. I cut my own hair. Not difficult because I cut it to 1/4 inch. I had the somewhat cheaper Wahl 79300-400 Color Pro clippers before and was quite pleased with them. These clippers have a plastic storage case to keep everything together. The case is smaller than the cloth case I had with the Color Pro clippers which is handy since I put the clippers under the already crowded sink.<br /><br />There is only one issue I have with the case. (You listening Wahl?) The case is kept closed by a plastic latch which has a cheap plastic strip hinge instead of a proper hinge. It's only a matter of time before that cheap hinge breaks. Wahl's marketeers might think a broken case will result in my buy a new set of shears; however, I'll just glue some hook-n-loop (a.k.a. velcro) in its place.<br /><br />I can heartily recommend this Wahl clipper. The cutting guides are good, and the clipper is easy to use. Best of all, when I give myself a hair cut, this clips more than one hair at a time.

  717. These clippers work well and pay for themselves with just a little use. These are sharp and work very well.
  718. Sure beats the price at the stores. You can't go wrong here.
  719. These clippers are great. I'm a male, who wants to start cutting my own hair to save money and give myself hair cuts more often. The clippers came in on time, and worked outta the box. They are sharp, functional, and easy to use! The product came with some instructions I follow the best I could, and my haircut is perfectly fine, especially for the first cut. The back is kinda hard to get but feel with your hair, use a mirror, or have someone by your side for help. These clippers come with oil as well. The guards for the clippers are basic guards, they work perfectly fine, as some people said they're &#34;flimsy&#34; well what? you want a guard made of steel or heavier material? You're cutting hair for gods sake. The guards are not as flimsy as people make them out to be. Yes if you push on it, it doesn't take a lot of force to &#34;bend&#34; them, but they move back, and while cutting hair, they don't bend one bit! They're great guards for this product.<br /><br />The case could use some more organization or a different layout, as I feel everything is cluttered in there.<br /><br />The clippers are LOUD, yes, not extremely loud, but a loud enough &#34;buzzzzzzzzzz&#34; But that loud buzz makes me feel like the clippers have power to them and isn't some cheaply made product. Most clippers will buzz, get over it. Are you wanting to get clippers that are whisper quiet? what's the need for that? sneak attack someones hair with it? no. forget the noise, it's not bad at all. Yes it also vibrates ever so slightly, which yet isn't a big deal. The loud noise, and the vibrating take NOTHING away from this product.<br /><br />Great product, well worth the purchase. Give it a chance. I will be happy giving myself free clean cuts with this. Practice makes almost perfect.

If you want it for full time use I say its the wrong trimmer because it can cut kinda slow but the blades stay sharp due to its self sharpening titanium blades. Just remember to use oil before and after every use to keep the blades cutting.

  728. i've had an undercut hairstyle for about three years now, and roughly every month i would need to take a trip to the barber to have the shaved side trimmed down so i wouldn't look like a shaggy mess, and each time i'd pay about $15 each time. lame! as a self-serving individual that hates dependency, i decided i would just maintain it myself. and it was an excellent decision. heck yeah.<br /><br />this kit comes with an awesome selection of different attachments, and the clipper itself cuts smoothly and cleanly without snagging on any hair. it comes with a handy instructional book that helps if you're shaving your hair for the first time, but i do recommend watching some instructional youtube videos to supplement that. it is a bit tricky to get used to, but it's certainly well worth the price and will save a load of money if you normally take frequent trips to the barber just to do a stupid simple trim. albeit, barbers need to pay their bills, too, so a trip every now and then doesn't hurt. they probably do a better job, anyway.<br /><br />nevertheless, this is an excellent clipper that cuts clean and smooth, and the kit comes with such a variety of length attachments it's kind of crazy. it's a brilliant deal for the price and the quality you get, so i highly recommend this kit.

  775. After some research on google, i was convinced that a human clipper and a pet clipper are basically the same so instead of shelling out an additional $30 (minimum) for a clipper labelled for pets, I decided to get this one. Well, I was not disappointed...but i was also being realistic with my expectation. First and foremost, this clipper did not overheat...at least it did not during the first 1.5 hours of continual use...after this duration..it started warming up but was still manageable... I have a pekingese and i used the 3/4\\" attachment. This does not mean that any fur longer than 3/4\\" will be cut...it simply means that fur will not be cut shorter than 3/4\\". You have to move slowly the clipper thru the fur...everytime, it will catch a bit and you will slowly and gradually trim the fur. In fact you don't want to go too fast or try and get too much of the fur coz that will clog up the blade. It was really not a bad set of clippers and if ONLY my furbaby would cooperate he would look less like an escapee from a mental hospital and more like a little prince! If you pet is well behaved, you can give this a try..and also try and cut outside or the backyard coz cleanup was another big hassle.

  789. Well, I purchased these clippers because I wanted to save a $20 bill for every haircut I get by doing it myself. Trust me the noise isn't that loud at all, and I used them in a closed bathroom. Getting to the point, the clippers worked great. I gave myself a perfect fade. I didn't use the clippers on the top of my head, I used the scissors provided. Using the scissors on the top made my hair look more professionally done. My wife was in Awe when she saw my haircut, and asked how the heck did I do this all by myself. The only thing I asked her to do was trim my neckline. I would recommend starting out with a higher number attachment, like I did, just to test out the length. I started out with a #4 to test, then used a #3. You can always work your way down, but you can't work your way back up, lol. To blend in the sides with the top, I just switched the lever on the clippers from up(closest cut) to down(longer cut). All in all, my hair looks like it was professionally done. P.S. this is the first time I've ever cut anybody's hair, besides my dog's. Maybe I'll start cutting hair on the side, lol.

  844. This Wahl Clipper is great! I use it to cut my hair myself and it does that quickly and easily. It's very quiet too. I was initially worried because other comments talked about the noise and vibration; but I figured, it's a hair clipper, what do you expect? However, I experienced none of those problems. I did notice my number 2 doesn't fit as snug as the other pieces, you can't tell by looking or feeling it though. This does cause an extra vibration noise, which I only notice because the clipper is so quiet. It cuts just as well as the others and, naturally, the noise disappears as soon as it's against your head. I also chose this product because I wanted a hard plastic case, not a soft bag. You just throw the pieces in the case, they don't have specific places to clip in or be placed. The case is big enough to easily fit all the pieces without having to worry about enough room to close it, but it's still quite small for easy storage. Also, everything is sturdy to where I don't have any worry about things breaking anytime soon; but, only time will tell for that. So far, I am very pleased with this product.

I use the 3 setting for the back and sides and the 8 for the top, and then I let the top grow out for a few of months while cutting the back and sides with the 3 about monthly. It's also useful for trimming my beard as well as hair in other locations.<br /><br />On the downside, it is a bit heavy, which isn't a problem for a strong guy like me, but I could see how it might be for a smaller, weaker person. Also, I could stand for it to have a little more power especially considering the fact that it works off of the wall outlet. It does also tend to catch hair between the blades, but this is easily cleaned out with the included brush. All in all, it's a fine product that has held up well with frequent use.

I usually buzz my hair down to about 1/4 of an inch and, with these clippers, I was to able to get the job done evenly and efficiently. The only drawback was the loud rattling noise it made when I turn it on.<br /><br />Unfortunately, the blades started to get dull after a few months of use. What used to take me 10 minutes, now takes 45 minutes as I have to repeat over the same spot several times to get satisfactory results. I partially blame myself for this because I neglected to oil my blades regularly. If you don't oil your blades regularly, they will get dull over time.<br /><br />It wouldn't be fair to trash a product for what is probably my own mistake, so I'm giving it 3/5 stars. It gets 4/5 stars for the way it cuts hair (when new), but loses a star for its noisiness.

  945. I have just finished my first cut with the Wahl Chrome Pro. I love it!<br /><br />I do know something about hair grooming as I was at one time pursuing a career in hair styling for the film industry. Instead, I went into sound recording. But I still learned a lot about hair. The first thing you learn is that Wahl's professional line of clippers in the top used brand of clippers by pros in the world. The second thing you learn is their reputation for quality and customer satisfaction.<br /><br />So I felt pretty confident that I wanted a Wahl clipper set when I went looking for one. After doing lots of research, reading many of the reviews here at Amazon, and looking for the right price point and combination of features, etc., I decided on the Chrome Pro.<br /><br />So far, it's perfect for what I need it to do. My hair cuts (basically a modified buzz cut) were costing me twenty dollars each by the stylist I was going to. She is good, and a pro, but sheesh, 20 bucks just to use a clipper to buzz off my hair? So having experience in the business, I looked around for prices at various places. The absolute best price was right here at Amazon. More on that in a minute.<br /><br />So in opening up the kit (all of the many accessories are listed above) I removed the clipper from the kit, took the twisty tie off the cable, found the blade comb I wanted and immediately started clipping. No set up, no prep needed. I had washed my hair, let it dry, and combed it. To get the length I like, I already knew the comb numbers from past experience. Wahl, and all other hair experts recommend that you start with the comb that leaves the most hair on your head first. You can always work your way down quickly by using the next number comb (higher numbers leave more hair; the lower the number, the closer the cut).<br /><br />With my kind of cut, you do the sides and back first, around the ear next, and then finally the top. So I found a number four comb, clicked it onto the clipper, which is very easy, and then started in on one side of my hair. Using the Wahl clipper is so easy that with my kind of cut, I can do it all myself. A color booklet comes with the kit and is very easy to follow. Wahl also has DIY videos on YouTube to watch. You use the arch or rocking technique as you move the clipper up the side of the head, pulling the clipper away from the top as you finish your move. It is very easy and I was finished with both sides and the back in a couple of minutes.<br /><br />Next, I found the Right and Left taper combs to cut around the ear. You start at the lower edge of hair on each side and cut in a circle around the ear all the way to the front. The Chrome Pro has a taper lever on the side and this adds a greater degree of adjustment as you cut. It will lower and raise the cutting blades in case a comb isn't quite low enough but the next comb would be too tight. Great feature!<br /><br />After I was done with both ears, I put the number six comb on the clipper (they change out instantly) and starting at the front of my hair, cut straight back at first as the hair fell off. The clipper and combs cut evenly and professional looking. I finished the top of my head from the back, moving from all directions over the swirl to ensure an even cut. After that was done, I took off the combs and with the help of a mirror, used the clipper to trim the side angles of the back and a straight line across the bottom. Easy as anything. The last thing you do is use the barber shears and styling comb to even out any cow licks and clean up around the ears. To finish off, a wetting of the hair and some Bed Head gel and I'm ready for town!<br /><br />After cleaning the clipper with the enclosed brush, it was back into the carry case and under the sink. I'll use this every week and my hair will stay looking great without growing long and then getting cut short again. My wife, who was doing my hair more recently, absolutely loved the cut and said she's retired fromcutting my hair.<br /><br />I have to mention price here. I had spotted this same clipper at Sam's Club for more money than Amazon. Add to that the local sales tax. This price point qualifies for free shipping. It said it would take five days to get here...it took two. So I saved $6.36 in shipping. Then at the time of my purchase, there was a Special Offer attached to this product (always look for Amazon's Special Offers). This was in the form of a $3 off coupon which you must click on to apply to the purchase. And if you don't already have an Amazon.com credit card, get one. You get points for all your purchases and can apply those to future purchases. I had $9.36 worth of points saved up already so I clicked to apply those to this purchase. My final cost, for the clipper kit and a bottle of [[ASIN:B000B9SFQG Wahl 4-Ounce Blade Oil]], which will last you the life of the clipper and onto your next one, was $17.88 at the time of purchase! Thanks Amazon.com for an incredible deal! For the price of just one hair cut, I've paid for the kit, and now the rest of the clipper's life my haircuts are free!<br /><br />So if you are in the market for a clipper, or just thinking about the possibility of doing your own hair, check out the Wahl Chrome Pro Haircut Kit. With Amazon's return policy, you can't really lose!cutting my hair.<br /><br />I have to mention price here. I had spotted this same clipper at Sam's Club for more money than Amazon. Add to that the local sales tax. This price point qualifies for free shipping. It said it would take five days to get here...it took two. So I saved $6.36 in shipping. Then at the time of my purchase, there was a Special Offer attached to this product (always look for Amazon's Special Offers).   1002. I bought this after trying out one from a family member. I used it the first time to give my husband a haircut that would be easy to deal with while hospitalized. He loved the cut and decided he wanted his hair to be that short. He dislikes getting a cut from a barber of hair salon.<br /><br />This comes with numerous black, plastic attachments that clip onto the unit itself and each one has a number and the enclosed chart shows a photo of each with its corresponding number and narrative description of what each can be used for. The thickest (and highest numbered) attachment will leave the hair longer as you glide the unit along the scalp and the head should be divided up into three sections with the neckline and ear area as one section or swath, the mid head the second swath, encircling the middle of the skull, and the top area the third section. You start at the neckline moving up to the edge of the middle or second swath, and follow the directions. There is a left and right ear attachment that you circle the ear with and it clips the hair as short as the rest of the hair. It also has an eyebrow attachment but we use scissors and fine comb to take care of that area so I don't know how well the eyebrow attachment works. You will receive two, long, fine-toothed black plastic combs, clips to section off the three areas of the hair (if it is longer), oil to oil the blades every few times the unit it used, and a lot of attachments to vary the length of the clipped hair.<br /><br />I have owned the Conair clippers and they are far inferior to this unit. The blades are sharp and we didn't need to blend the hair at the edges of the swath lines like the instructions state you may need to do. Highly recommended!

  1005. I should have bought these years ago!<br />Got them because I was ready for a change. I generally will go a few years between hair cuts or get it cut once every month or two so I never was one to waste much on barbers. But now finding myself on a fixed income and deciding to wear my hair short for however long the mood strikes I decided at the price trying these made far more sense that paying half of what they cost for one hair cut.<br />This is a great set with many attachments so choosing what length you want to keep your hair is easy to do. Cutting my own hair was far easier than expected. I will admit I cut it a little shorter than originally planed but not as short as it could of been. So like anything else there is a learning curve involved<br />The clippers themselves are made in the USA and have a quality feel to them. The attachments are like everything else these days and made in China which is fine because they do the job and outsourcing that while making what really counts here in the USA is why you can buy it at such a great price.<br />i read reviews complaining about the scissors that come with this set being cheap Chinese crap. I found that though yes they do look cheap they are very sharp and work just as expected if not better. A decent pair of hair stylist scissors would cost many times the cost of this whole set!<br />My one complaint is the so called book of instructions which is more like a small fold out poster with basic instructions and not a book. But again what you are paying for here is a really good hair clipper which would be well worth the price without all the extras.<br />Bottom line - If you can afford hundreds of dollars a year (2x a month = $30 X 12) getting your hair cut than do it because barbers got families to feed too. But if like me without money to throw away (it just grows back) or just looking to cut costs somewhere these are a great buy and will not only pay for themselves but also help you start saving money real fast!<br /><br />The main thing to keep in mind whether cutting your own hair or that of other family members there is a learning curve involved and the hair cuts may not come out perfect at first. But once you get the hang of it people won't be able to tell if you did it yourself or paid for it.

However, this is the clear winner when it comes to trimming hair and getting the right length. Unfortunately I bought it for beard trimming, and the clips and power of the instrument is far too great for clipping hair on your face! Look elsewhere for beard trimming, but if you're cutting hair on your heard, this is PERFECT.

The only con I can see with this product is that this is more of a trimming kit than haircut kit, but can still be used to cut your hair if you are looking to trim it only and not cut it with scissors.   1092. I don't know if its just me, but the Wahl line of clippers tends to confuse me. Sometimes I literally cannot figure out what the difference is between certain models, but I selected these over the Home Pro model because with the Amazon coupon there was only a 4 dollar difference.<br /><br />As far as I'm concerned the Chrome Pro clippers work like a charm. I have pretty thick hair, and these cut through it like butter. No jamming, or hair pulling, or bogging down of the clippers. They aren't the quietest clippers I'm sure, but they aren't loud enough that I would complain or make a big deal about it... even my 5 year old didn't seem to mind them buzzing around his ears. They seem a bit heavy, and I am pretty sure the \\"chrome\\" cover is painted plastic.. but its the internal components that I am concerned about.. not the cosmetics.<br /><br />I dig the scissors, probably will never use the cheap feeling apron, don't have much of a need for more than 3 of the guides, and feel that the combs are decent quality. Overall, I am very happy with this product for the price I paid. The price went up about 10 bucks over night though, which is a bummer.. but I am excited that I got my purchase in as I don't feel they are quite worth the new higher price.

  1095. I was amazed at how much was included with the product. It was all put in a nice box that makes it easy to store. I powered up the clippers and yeow, what a noise. They were so loud that you could probably hear them 2 houses away. I was close to returning them but thought I would do a little searching on Google first. It turns out there is an adjustment screw on the side to limit the power or travel (not sure which) of the blades. I backed it off about 1/4 turn and they now sound like normal clippers.<br /><br />They cut cleanly without any pulling and the wide variety of guides makes a haircut a breeze. I did not find the guides flimsy as others mentioned in the reviews. I don't see why they need to be any heavier. The included apron is marginally effective, I have fine hair it is stuck to the apron like glue so storing it sans hair is rather difficult. They included scissors but are pretty cheap, of course a good pair would cost more than the whole kit so what do you expect.<br /><br />My only complaint is the unit should have been adjusted at the factory and there was nothing specific in the literature about what to do if the clippers are loud. I took a star off for this.<br /><br />Overall I think this is a great value and works for cutting hair at home.

The clippers are a nice hefty size but they're comfortable and I had no problem holding them and cutting with them. The blades are sharp, so I took my time cutting the hair to avoid pinches or discomfort. I was able to cut my son's hair in a very low haircut and shaped the lines around his head, nicely.   1229. Pro: -The price -Some useful attachments -Durable storage case -Adjustable blade (zero gap can be done) -A T-Blade can be use to replace the blade -Cutting my hair a #3 all around and then getting a line-up/shape-up from my barber does save me some money. :) Con: -It was loud, at first. To fix the problem TURN OFF the clipper and turn the power screw clockwise until it stops. Don't force the plastic screw too much or else you may break the plastic screw. Then, turn it on and turn the plastic screw counter-clockwise until the noise is reduce. This definitely helped me. Now it sounds like a hair clipper from a barbershop. By the way, the power screw moves the white plastic underneath the blade. Turning the power screw too much counter-clockwise can misaligned the blades. Check out this video for an idea. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7QdJ2QLpy4 Durability is questionable. I wouldn't use this, if I were a barber.

  1244. My stylist wife has owned a set of these clippers since we were married almost ten years ago. She liked these even better than her nice salon set that had broken. She determined that these were finally getting dull, so I decided to buy her the same pair again as a gift -- since they've lasted so long, and are quite inexpensive. Here's the catch (which I think is actually a good thing), once she had her new set, I took the old, dull clippers apart and figured I'd try sharpening them myself. Since they had been decommissioned, it wouldn't matter if it didn't work out too well. I followed some online instructions to carefully lap the blades on a nice, flat honing stone, and then oiled and put them back together. The blades' faces now had almost a mirror polish on them -- rather than the factory finish that showed some machine marks. I have some experience with metal work, so I'm not saying I just plunked them on my DIY workbench and did the job, but it really wasn't hard.<br /><br />Now the old, sharpened clippers work better than the new ones I just bought. They're so quiet, and cut really well. My wife refuses to use the new set until I pull them apart and sharpen the blades the same way. I'm impressed that a set of clippers that is frankly quite inexpensive was actually serviceable. I'm an even bigger fan now, although I don't know if I'll ever need to buy another set in my life.

  1285. I'm not normally one prone to exaggeration, but in this case, there is no way to describe this product other than \\"garbage\\". It took me over half an hour to accomplish it with these. They simply cut a path so narrow through the hair that it defies belief. Because of that one fact alone, nothing else about this kit matters. The heads it provides for cutting don't matter. The brush doesn't matter. The scissors don't matter. It is extremely noisy and vibrating - it deafens my ears.<br /><br />People from Europe - be aware that if you buy this hair cutter from US, you will have issue with the electrical characteristics - this one is designed for 110 volt and 60 hertz electricity. Currently I am not sure if the noise and vibrations are due to the transformation of the electricity or there is some issue with the hair cutting device.

  1379. I used a Philips Norelco dedicated &#34;beard and mustache&#34; trimmer for several years until it died one day. Looking for a replacement, I found this gem and chose it because it got good reviews and the price was right. These clippers feel very solid and obliterate hair, meaning they perform their designated function, which I can honestly say the Norelco stuggled with sometimes. The guards are cheap-ish plastic, but I only use guards 2 and lower and have had no problem whatsoever, even after changing them out many times. This might become an issue for someone who uses larger guards, as the guards may bend, especially if the user presses down really hard on them (but then that person's probably not doing it right). Yes they're loud, but what clippers aren't? Especially for this price. They definitely aren't for shaving without using a guard; the unit is loud because the blades are sharp and moving very fast and would love to chew up soft flesh if given the opportunity. A great item for beard maintenance, though!

  1385. So we have a couple of standard poodles (the big ones). My wife got an Andis dog clipper like the groomers use so she could groom the dogs herself. Well, that was the only clippers we had so....yeah. She cleaned the blade off with alcohol and strapped me down to the chair. I feel sorry for the dogs. This \\"professional\\" Andis clipper blade pretty much yanked the hair out of my head. In between my wailing and moaning she'd say, \\"Sorry\\"...bzzzz...yank!<br />True story...and a sad one (stop laughing).<br /><br />Alright! Well, that was it! I told her we are going to get a HUMAN CLIPPER right now and I don't care the cost! Fortunately, this Wahl clipper kit was very reasonably priced for what you get (and far cry less expensive than our $180 dog hair pullers, I mean, clippers). All the good reviews prompted me to select this one and I'm glad I did. It cuts as smooth as a hot knife through soft butter.<br /><br />It comes with 2 hair clips for victims with longer hair, 2 combs, scissors, 13 blades, a maintenance kit (brush/screwdriver and oil), a blade cover, a hard plastic case, and a plastic apron. First off, the plastic apron is nothing more than a kitchen garbage bag in the shape of an apron...seriously. Toss it out! It builds up so much static electricity that it literally attracts the hair to you ON BOTH SIDES and covers you with the clippings. I got a real apron instead. One of the [[ASIN:B007ROCZVY Salon Sundry Professional Hair Salon Nylon Cape with Snap Closure - 50\\" x 60\\"]]<br />Secondly, the cleaning brush works great for for the blade but the screwdriver end is a bit flimsy for adjusting the blade power (see the instruction manual). I used a real flat head screwdriver for that. Everything else in the kit seems to be high quality.<br /><br />Some of the unique and, perhaps, more helpful accessories are the Left and Right side taper combs (I don't think my wife's ever even looked at those yet--she's still doing it the hard way), the ear guard (you can cut the hair evenly over your ears without getting \\"white walls\\"), and the eyebrow guard. You know...for the older, bushy eyebrow gals--and guys--not that I'm one of those ;-)<br /><br />There are some great videos on doing clipper cuts on YouTube. There's a good one made by a military guy who shows men how to cut their own hair with the clippers (something most of us military guys have had to do more than once). If you're super cheap, like me--or you don't have someone to cut your hair, doing it yourself with this kit is a super easy. The guide combs do it all for you! Comes with instructions.<br /><br />Wife says it's lightweight and easy to hold (the clippers, I mean). Made in the USA--like me.air evenly over your ears without getting \\"white walls\\"), and the eyebrow guard. You know...for the older, bushy eyebrow gals--and guys--not that I'm one of those ;-)<br /><br />There are some great videos on doing clipper cuts on YouTube. It is not battery powered so having to leave it plugged in while using acan be a bit of a restriction, however it is powerful. It actually bucks in your hand when you power it up. I think people could use it on horses without a problem and can see no possible head of human hair that this clipper could not handle for years. For the price, it's the best deal out there.

I'm actually going to switch back to the old set, which I'm glad I kept, and maybe keep the new set as a backup. Or just throw it away and look for something else. Amazon shipped this item completely loose in a box, with no padding or air cushioning of any kind. There's no way to prove that this shipping method caused internal damage to the clippers, but having worked with clippers for 20 years, I know you can't be very rough with them.   1606. I bought this unit to replace a Conair haircut kit that was starting to get old. I use electric trimmer to cut my own hair, generally by using a 2 on the sides, 4 on top, and a 3 in between. The first unit I received had a loud buzzing noise and misaligned blades that produced an uneven haircut, so I sent it back to Amazon for a replacement. The current one is aligned correctly, though it still seems like the motor is on the cusp of being loud at some point in the future. I have no idea what causes that. I'm giving this 4 stars because it does what it says and it comes at a great price, though I can't say I wouldn't prefer a new Conair if I had to make the purchase over again.
  1607. Had to buy this new Wahl cutter due to Hurricane Sandy. After the storm i used the old Wahl once. Worked fine but second time it was problematic. Not surprised though; it did get flooded.   1608. To start: I'm not cheap. I just don't see the point in spending money I don't need to. This haircut kit was one of the best investments I've made in a long time. After cutting my own hair just three times it had already paid for itself, and that's assuming a fairly cheap haircut.<br /><br />I've used other systems in the past that got extremely hot after a few minutes of use and would be very uncomfortable on my neck, and others that pulled hairs out when they got caught in the blades. This system isn't like that at all.<br /><br />Some tips:<br /><br />- Be VERY CAREFUL when using the ear trimming guides! The first time I used it, I didn't angle the buzzer enough and the opposite side buzzed a small section out of my hair. I learned my lesson and like using them now, but I'm much more careful now.<br /><br />- For the best-looking haircut (for a guy with short hair) don't be afraid to use the scissors on the top, and don't worry about making it PERFECTLY even. (If you want it perfectly even, use the buzzer with a guide) I've found that the slightly uneven look is much more attractive than just using a buzz guide and doing the whole thing that way. It takes some practice and a little more time, but looks much better (IMO).<br /><br />- Get some other kind of detail buzzer for the back of your neck. Even the sideburn trimmer on an electric razor works well. Also, get someone else to do the back of your neck. I tried doing it myself recently, and although it didn't turn out TERRIBLE, it was terribly difficult and would have been better with some help.<br /><br />Assuming a hair cut every 6 weeks (my usual) at about $10 after tip (at a really cheap place in a college town), this little kit saves me about $87/year - enough to pay for my Amazon Prime membership (which already pays for itself, btw). AND it's just about the best system I was able to find out there. HESITATE NO MORE!

But then, what isn't more cheaply built nowadays? It also is slightly louder than the Wahl clipper I previously owned for 15 years, probably due to the lighter weight housing. But all this was simply a minor disappointment.<br /> The clipper is lighter than the old one and cuts well which is, after all, its purpose. It came with a full set of attachments and the kit was reasonably priced; so it qualifies as a very good deal. I would recommend this product.

  1634. A man's haircut is anywhere from $12-$15 a pop, every two weeks. Maybe more if you go somewhere really nice. That adds up! So when my husband asked me to cut his hair at home to save money, I was all for it. Originally we had bought a higher end Con-Air brand. Too soon after purchasing, the power went downhill and the blades seemed dulled. Obviously it cut like s---. I had been eyeing this model so when Amazon had one of their awesome daily deals on Wahl I didn't hesitate to purchase it. What a difference! It cuts beautifully. Lots of power, sharp blades. It comes with a lot of accessories but I can't say I have used all of them. The scissors it comes with are dull and cheap, the comb teeth are too big (for short hair), and the plastic garbage bag used as a barber cape is a joke. BUT the actual clippers, the most important part, works really well. The combs clip on easily and the side gauge slides effortlessly. Very easy to use. It looks nice too with a chrome finish. Highly recommend. This is great for home use!
  1635. I've had two Wahl clipper prior to this one, both worked great. The last one I purchased several years ago, worked wonderfully, and recently died. I oiled it as the directions said to. After a few uses, I can't take it anymore. I had to go to a barber after each haircut attempt. It's not only painful to use, it also leaves long patches of hair.   1643. HONESTLY, these clippers, despite the glowing reviews of people who say they cut like butter, DON'T cut like butter. I wish they did, as it takes too many passes to complete my own haircut, ESPECIALLY when using the 3/4 guard on the top of my head. What's even more unfortunate is that I don't currently have a three-way mirror and poor lighting in my bathroom, requiring many passes on the back of my head to get it even. It works better than my dying pair and it looks nice, BUT IT DOESN'T WORK AS WELL AS PEOPLE SAY. Get a ceramic-bladed set; these types of clippers tend to perform better on cutting in the first place.<br /><br />Pros: Cheap/Sexy<br /><br />Cons: Cheap(low-quality)/Metal blade/Takes twice as long to cut my hair and much more patience
